alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Moore and Lincoln Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pulaski, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Mulberry, Howell, Belleville, Dellrose, Lois, Mimosa, Booneville and Skinem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
